item.title: Tota11y: An Accessibility Visualization Toolkit
item.description: Tota11y is a tool to find accessibility issues on websites. Install the bookmarklet and a small button will be displayed when the bookmarklet is toggled. It runs a single javascript file on checks the page against accessibility criteria. Select criteria from the menu, and tota11y will visually call out the areas you may need to review, providing a description of the issue and recommendations for making the element accessible. The free tool is provided by Khan Academy.

item.title: 1 1 1 1 dns service
item.description: 1.1.1.1 is a DNS service created by Cloudflare and APNIC to offer you a more private experience on the Internet. Here’s what they say: Unfortunately, by default, DNS is usually slow and insecure. Your ISP, and anyone else listening in on the Internet, can see every site you visit and every app you use — even if their content is encrypted. Creepily, some DNS providers sell data about your Internet activity or use it target you with ads.

item.title: RGBA feColorMatrix
item.description: feColorMatrix is an SVG filter that changes colors based on a transformation matrix. Every pixel’s color value (represented by an [R,G,B,A] vector) is matrix multiplied to create a new color. This filter allows granular per channel color manipulation. Una Kravets wrote an excellent article explaining how to use it.

item.title: Storyboarder
item.description: Wonderunit’s Storyboarder is a free storyboarding application for the Mac that lets you visualize a story quickly. Quickly sketch your stick figures, then create and show animatics to others.

item.title: Graphic Design Basics
item.description: Designers Ellen Lupton and Jennifer Cole Phillips, authors of the book Graphic Design, The New Basics  and Directors of the MFA Program at Maryland Institute College of Art offer a free 35 minute Skillshare course walking through 5 basic principles of graphic design. The course is a quick primer on design principles suited to various visual design projects.
